The 'Academy Award for Best Costume Design' is one of the Academy Awards of
Merit presented annually by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
(AMPAS) for achievement in film costume design.

The award was first given for films made in 1948. Initially, separate award
categories were established for black-and-white films and color films. Since the
merger of the two categories in 1967, the Academy has traditionally avoided
giving out the award to contemporary films.
